page.title: 19CASTLETOWN HOME BAKING.
page.content: {Bere Bannocks}2 cups of bere meal,a pinch of salt, 30g of butter,butter- milk to mix.Sift flour and salt, rub in butter and mix to a soft dough. Place on a floured surface,knead lightly and roll out until 1cm thick. Place on a fairly hot girdle.When scones are brown turn over and cook other side.Serve with butter or jam. {Broonie}120g plain flour,150g oatmeal,60g butter,90g sugar,1 tsp. bicarbonate of soda,1 tsp.ground ginger,2 tbsp.treacle,1 egg,6 fl.oz.sour milk.Sift flour,ginger and bicarbonate of soda.Add oatmeal.Rub in fat until mixture looks like breadcrumbs.Melt treacle.Stir into the flour mixture with the sugar and egg.Add milk to give a dropping consistency.Bake in a greased tin in a moderate oven until firm and well risen(1-11/2 hours).
